intro: Gurania ovata var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered gurania, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers clustered in terminal inflorescences, which bloom during the summer months. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
